sources.title: The Phantom Fiend
sources.description: The first talking remake of the 1927 Alfred Hitchcock classic, The Lodger. Stars Ivor Novello in the role of the lodger and an early appearance by Jack Hawkins. Produced by Julius Hagen and directed by Maurice Elvey

sources.title: The Phantom Fiend (1932) JACK THE RIPPER
sources.description:
Stars: Ivor Novello, Elizabeth Allan, A.W. Baskcomb 
Director: Maurice Elvey

The first sound remake of the Hitchcock silent classic The Lodger. Both films were adapted from the novel by Marie Adelaide Belloc Lowndes which is based on the Whitechapel murdersof 1888, committed by Jack the Ripper

metadata.Plot: This was the first sound remake of the Hitchcock silent classic inspired by the Jack the Ripper legend. Ivor Novello, who played the title role and headed the team writing the script, was in the original as well.
metadata.Writer: Marie Belloc Lowndes, Miles Mander, Paul Rotha
metadata.Actors: Ivor Novello, Elizabeth Allan, A.W. Baskcomb
